com.esri.mo2.ui.bean
Class Legend

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.Legend
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FeatureLegend, GroupLegend
public class Legend
extends JComponent

A visual representation of a Layer within a Table of Contents (Toc). This class is the base class for all Legends within the Toc. It is provided mainly for drag-and-drop purposes, so that, when an end-user drags within the Toc, it is a Legend that is being dragged. And, when the Legend is "dropped", you can access the corresponding Layer.

A Legend can be highlighted by calling the setSelected() method. When a Toc has the AutoSelecting property set to true, then each time a Legend is clicked with the left mouse button, the Legend is then automatically selected. If you choose to set AutoSelecting to false, then you must manually call setSelected to highlight the Legend. This class

See Also:
Toc, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Legend

public Legend(Layer layer,
              Toc toc)
construct a Legend for the given Layer. the checkbox and title components are constructed here, also a default collection of colours to be used for animating the checkbox during a retrieval

Parameters:
layer - the associated Layer
toc - the container TOC

setAnimationColors

public void setAnimationColors(Collection colors)
Specifies a set of colors to be used to create an animation when a retrieval is occuring. The animation consists of repainting the checkbox with the specified colors used to paint the background.

Parameters:
colors - a collection of colors, accessed in turn by Iterator

setSelected

public void setSelected(boolean b)
with this method you can choose to show that a Legend has been selected

Parameters:
b - true == select the Layer, false == deselect the Layer

isSelected

public boolean isSelected()
indicate if the Legend is currently selected

Returns:
true == the Legend is selected, false == otherwise

getLayer

public Layer getLayer()
get the Layer associated with this Legend

Returns:
the Layer

refresh

public void refresh()
refresh the contents of this Legend. You don't normally need to call this method, but might need to if you change the content of the Layer - for example, if you change the symbology of the Layer's Renderer.

getTitleText

public String getTitleText()
get the text that will be used for this Legend. By default it is the Layer name trimed of leading and trailing spaces. Override in subclasses to change this.

setShowDetails

public void setShowDetails(boolean b)
hide/show the legend details of the specified Layer. Note that this is not the same is changing the Layer's visibility. When the legend details are hidden, the CheckBox and Title will still be shown, any other details are not shown.

Parameters:
b - true == show the details, false == hide the details
See Also:
Toc.setHidden(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.Layer, boolean)

getShowDetails

public boolean getShowDetails()
determine if the legend details are currently shown/hidden

Returns:
true == legend details are currently shown, false == hidden
